explanation:
toxdigitvalue — the called function’s prototype/definition must be inspected because it could use compiler extensions (attributes, inline asm, non-standard calling conventions or non-standard types) that affect whether the target uses language extensions.
size_t — size_t is a typedef/macro provided by headers; its definition must be checked to ensure it is the standard type (from <stddef.h>) and not provided via a compiler-specific extension or non‑standard typedef.
bool — the identifier 'bool' may be the standard _Bool/type from <stdbool.h> or a project/compiler extension/typedef; verifying its origin is necessary to determine if a language extension is used.
uint8_t — this fixed-width integer type should come from <stdint.h>; its definition must be verified to ensure it is standard and not a compiler-specific extension or macro.
NULL — the NULL macro can be defined in non-standard ways by some environments; confirm it is the standard macro and not a compiler-specific extension.
MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE — this compile-time macro controls alternate code paths (preprocessor conditional). Its definition or how it is set may rely on build-specific/compiler extension behavior; inspect it to know which path is compiled and to check whether that path uses any language extensions.
